blog.name: justincorrectmarvelquotes
blog.title: I Swear They Said it
blog.description: "Act up, you can get smashed up." -City Girls

summary: Peter don't know how, but he is stuck on the ceiling.
question: Peter don't know how, but he is stuck on the ceiling.
answer:
“Mr. Stark!” Peter cried from the living room ceiling, his hands and toes almost conjoined to the plaster. He had gone up there to squash a bug and figured out that his fingers had stuck to it. At first, it came off as normal. Every so often, Peter’s limbs would get sticky and somehow attach to the surface he was on as a safety mechanism. He would always be able to detach himself though and get down or off without too much pain.

But for some reason, this time, his body didn’t want him to unstick. He tried hard to pull his socks away from the ceiling, only to get a little off before it started to throb.

“Mr. Stark!” He shrieked one more time, soon hearing footsteps racing to his room. He witnessed the door swing open and Tony emerged, in his nanotech undersuit.

“What is it?” He asked, urgently getting ready to press his chest plate. He quickly dropped his hand though as Peter was nowhere to be seen.

“Up here,” Peter called, trying to pull up a hand to wave in his direction. Tony looked up towards his voice and frowned. “I thought you were dying.” He said dryly, slinging off his sweatshirt and tying it around his waist. “Are you stuck?”

Peter nodded slowly, trying once again to get his feet free. To no avail though. “This has happened before.” He informed the engineer, as the man got a stool and stood on it, getting level with Peter’s face. He reached up and started to pull at the kid’s hand, trying to rip it free.

“Ow ow ow, okay stop!” Peter called, swatting Tony’s hand away as soon as he felt his skin rip. “That isn’t going to work.”

Tony huffed and got off the stool, putting his hands on his hips, in thought. This was tricky.

“I call the doctor.” He announced, taking out his phone and immediately going into his contacts.

“We need to get him to calm down,” Stephen said, once he was over there and examine the stuck boy.

“How do we do that?” Tony asked, crossing his arms. His worry began to show over time as he stood under Peter in case he suddenly fell without warning.

“What calms you down, Peter?” Stephen asked, rising to look into Parker’s eyes. Peter thought for a moment and nodded silently.

“Okay, I think I got it.” He said, and Stephen descended back to the ground to give Peter some room. Peter closed his eyes and took in a deep breath, trying his best to clear his mind. Tony watched intently, getting ready to catch the boy if need be. The cloak was also at the ready. Suddenly Peter became unstuck and fell right into Tony’s arm, making him fall over as well, the cloak quickly caught the both of them before they did too much damage.

“Nice one, Pete,” Tony said, a little out of breath. Peter smiled sheepishly as he got to his feet, helping Tony to his as well.

“What had thought of?” Stephen asked as the cloak returned to his shoulders. Peter went silent once again and kicked the ground nervously.

“Never Gonna Give You Up, by Rick Astley.” He mumbled. 

Tony sighed exasperatedly and pressed his hand to his face.

summary:
Daisy: anyway, why are we talking about me? What’s going on between you and Natasha?
Tony: nothing. She’s a respected...
body:
Daisy: anyway, why are we talking about me? What’s going on between you and Natasha?

Tony: nothing. She’s a respected colleague.

Daisy, unconvinced: uh-huh.

Tony: we both don’t have time to pursue a relationship. She’s been working really hard and doing an amazing job with the Accords, they’re too important and she can’t be distracted right now. Natasha’s a remarkable woman, she’s a valued friend, she’s…standing right behind me isn’t she?

Natasha: don’t let that stop you.

*she leans over him, flirtatiously*

Natasha: keep digging.


/————————/

Again inspired by delicate, by @queeenpersephone go check it out guys!!

source:
Tony attempts to learn magic (chp. 15)

Catch and Release by Like_a_Hurricane (AO3)
The Avengers (Marvel Movies) – Explicit – Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Loki/Tony Stark, Jane Foster/Thor
#Alternate Universe #Extended Marvel Universe #Obscure Comics References #Slow Build #Trust Issues #Politics #Worldbuilding #Torture #Miscommunication #BAMF!Loki #BAMF!Tony Stark #Violence #Dragon #Sex #Magic #Double Penetration #Dreamwalking #Extremis #Temperature Play #Pining #Multiverse complications

Here unfolds a tale of war, desire, and warring desires.

After the invasion of New York, Tony figures out Loki’s game, and he lays out an ultimatum that he realizes the trickster can’t escape from, maneuvering Loki into agreeing to be an ally, rather than a foe, if only when the time comes.

A god’s sworn word is a promise that the god cannot break, but once Thanos’ head is parted from his shoulders, all bets will be off: no protections, no alliance, Loki free to do whatever he pleases, so long as he can still evade recapture at Asgard’s hands. So it’s simple, Tony tells himself: trust the war, not the god.

It should have been simple. It was doomed to be anything but, because infatuation has no place in a war-zone, but Tony is prone to impropriety at all sorts of slightly impractical times, or he wouldn’t have wound up with the god of lies in his bed so frequently in the first place. Practicality and safe-distance plans are all going wrong, and Tony likes it too much to stop.

summary: Three Little Raptors
title: Three Little Raptors
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Hi4AHS

by colorworld

“I think Bleue went that way!” Tony sweeps around when he hears Bruce yell.

“Blue?” He blinks, absolutely perplexed as hell.

“No, it’s Bleue!” Thor corrects innocently. “Spiderling told me it is French for blue, as we named Aka for red in Japanese, and Zahri for pink in Arabic!”

Tony is looking at Thor with fury that makes him shut up immediately and his face is cowering down. Thor is now facing the incredible and extreme protectiveness of a father in this very moment. “You made three fucking baby velociraptors?” Tony practically screeches.

summary: The Boy Next Door
title: The Boy Next Door
body:
Tony peers through the curtains above the kitchen sink, smirking as Harley and Peter cannonball into the pool, laughing and splashing happily. They’ve been inseparable since Peter and his aunt had moved in next door three years ago. Peter was just on the edge of 14, weeks from his birthday and upon meeting Harley had found a friend for life.

It’s three weeks to Peter’s 17th birthday and Tony and May have been planning his party for months. The vintage VW Bug he’s purchased for Peter would be an extravagant gift if it wasn’t a rusted out junker that would need a full year of work to get it operational.

He had told May of his plans to have he and Peter work on the vehicle together so the kid would learn practical skills in mechanical engineering, a topic he knew fascinated Peter. He’d assured her he’d cover the cost of parts, and so long as Peter kept his grades up, he’d get the keys to the vehicle the day he turned 18.

He’d done the same thing for Harley and the two years of hard work had paid off—the shiny cherry red 76 Camaro was parked in the driveway and had earned Harley a full ride to the local technical college and the offer of a job from a local garage.

He hopes that Peter will have as much fun working on the car with him; the kid is naturally curious and staggeringly smart, so Tony’s sure he’ll pick up quickly on the skills needed to repair the vehicle that’s now waiting in the garage, covered by a tarp, just waiting to be revealed on his birthday.

The screeching of the screen door draws his attention to where Peter is careening around the corner, eyes going wide as his wet feet slip on the tile. He watches in slow motion as Peter falls forward, right for the sharp corner of the granite countertop.

He’s moving before he realizes it, grabbing Peter’s arms and hauling him up, mere breaths before he slams into the unforgiving stone. His heart beats too fast as he holds onto the kid for just a beat longer than normal, one hand plastered to the wet skin of his back.

“Shit,” he breathes, pulling back to run an assessing gaze over Peter, free hand tangling in those soft brown curls. “You gotta slow down kid, I don’t want to have to take you to the hospital again. Your Aunt almost murdered me last time.”

Peter flushes and nods, glancing away as he bites his lip, “Sorry Tony,” he murmurs, looking up through his lashes at Tony. He worries at his lower lip with his teeth and Tony watches as it turns a rosy shade of pink at the attention, wet and shiny and something curls warm and wanting through his gut.

Clearing his throat he steps back and pats the kid’s shoulder awkwardly, “Great, uh, dinner in thirty,” he mutters before turning away and attempting to focus his attention on the chicken kebabs he had been working on.

He listens to Peter rustling through the fridge for a snack before he disappears back out to the pool, laughing loudly at something Harley says too softly for him to hear. Glancing out the window, he watches as Peter throws his head back, eyes shut as he laughs, stepping back and then swaying as he loses his balance on the edge of the pool and promptly falls in with a shriek.

Tony can’t help the laugh that bursts out, affection warm in his chest. He continues skewering chicken and vegetables, the earlier moment with Peter pushed far from his mind.

The further from his mind, the better. 

His old friend insomnia makes a vicious return for him and he finds himself wandering the house nearly every night for two weeks, somehow managing to survive on three hours a night, exhaustion sinking deep into his bones.

He’s in his study for the fourth night in a row this week working on sketches for zero emission engines he’s been tinkering with lately and despite his mind numbing exhaustion he’s getting further on them than he has in the past year.

Footsteps creak on the floor behind him and he turns, smiling tiredly when he sees Peter, hovering in the doorway, the long sleeves of his sweater hanging to his knuckles, looking small in the oversized fabric. He gives Tony a weak smile and waves before shuffling over and peering down at the sketch, thin fingers trailing over the paper slowly.

“Can’t sleep?” Tony asks, studying the young man, noting the dark circles beneath his eyes, much like his own.

Peter nods and leans on the desk, head bowed. “I had a nightmare,” he murmurs hoarsely, “about Uncle Ben.”

Tony’s stomach swoops at the admission; Peter and his Uncle had been out for ice cream when a mugger murdered Ben for five bucks, leaving a twelve year old Peter to watch the man bleed out on the pavement.

“Do you want to talk about it?” he offers quietly, heart plummeting when Peter shakes his head and makes a soft broken noise. When his shoulders shake Tony grabs his hand and tugs, pulling him down into his lap so he can wrap his arms firmly around Peter.

Tiny hiccuping sobs make Peter’s shoulders shake and Tony feels like his chest will crack under the strain of the sorrow inside him. He holds Peter tighter and tucks his head under his chin, lips pressing to his hair as Peter cries.

“Shhh, it’s okay sweetheart, you’re safe, I’ve got you,” Tony croons, hand making slow circles over his back. Tony rocks him, blinking rapidly against the tears making his throat thick, nose burying in his soft locks as he inhales the warm clean scent he instantly identifies as Peter.

His fingers push through Peter’s hair, tugging gently before coming back to slide through again, over and over, soothing and gentle. He hears Peter’s breathing hitch and pulls him closer, “‘S that feel good?” he asks, hoping that he’s not hurting the kid or overstepping by offering this gentle comfort.

Peter nods and squirms in his lap and Tony tugs on his hair, “Just relax kid, I’ve got you,” he murmurs, running his fingers through Peter’s hair, thumb making small circles behind his ear. Peter shudders and makes a soft noise that sounds like a moan and it occurs to him suddenly, that this is inappropriate.

When he stops caressing Peter the boy makes a low, displeased sound and arches into his hand, “Feels good,” he murmurs, “please?”

And who is Tony to deny him?

He nods unsteadily and resumes, heat building under his skin when Peter sighs and rolls his hips, another sound coming from the boy that’s positively filthy. He can hear Peter’s breathing growing uneven, hot on his skin where his face is pressed to Tony’s neck.

His nails drag through Peter’s hair, some dark, hungry part of him wanting to hear those sounds again, and he’s rewarded with a whimper from Peter, hand curling and digging into Tony’s shoulder as his hips stutter upward. A quick glance down shows him the kid is hard; swallowing hard, he closes his eyes and tells himself he’s just being comforting.

It’s a lie, but it’s one he needs to tell.

“S-sorry,” Peter whispers breathily, still clutching desperately to Tony’s shoulder.

“For what kid?”

“‘M not a kid,” is the petulant reply, followed by a soft whine when Tony tugs on his hair experimentally. Peter goes still on his lap, breathing too fast and uneven to be anything but arousal.

“You okay?” Tony asks, fingers resuming their trail through his hair and against his skin.

“Y-yeah…’s just…my hair,” Peter gasps, whimpering again when Tony tugs lightly.

“That?” he asks, voice low and hot and Christ, he’s going to hell for how it makes his cock twitch to hear Peter’s breath hitch, hot and wet against his throat.

“Mmmhmmm.”

“Feels good?”

Peter gasps when Tony’s nails scratch at his scalp, hips jolting, “Y-Yes, yes, please,” he whines and fuck, Tony’s a goner.

His free hand slides under Peter’s sweater so he can drag his nails down his back, biting back a groan when the kid shudders and moans, arching into him, soft pleas whispered in his ear. “Please….Mr. Stark, please,” he begs, voice cracking and shit, he should stop, this isn’t right and he knows that.

“I’m sorry kid,” he grinds out, “I’ll stop,” he whispers, but his hands remain on Peter and neither of them move as Peter whines and shakes his head.

“Please don’t, please.”

Shit.

His hand tightens in Peter’s hair, the one at his back pressing hard in counterpoint and Peter gasps, face pressing into his neck with wet, hot breathy moans.

“Please Tony, please.”

Cursing himself, he presses his lips to Peter’s hair, “It’s okay sweetheart, shhh, you’re okay. You’re so good Peter, c’mon sweetheart, it’s okay,” he rambles, feeling it when Peter shudders and moans, hips rolling up into nothing. He pets and rubs Peter, heat in his cheeks and burning low in his gut and to his shame, he realizes he too is hard.

It’s just biology he tells himself, a reaction to having a pretty, aroused boy in his lap, begging to cum. It’s not Peter…it can’t be, because then he’d be a goddamn monster.

He tugs too hard on Peter’s hair and feels it a moment later when the kid cries out, the sound muffled against his throat as he sobs, hips hitching, and cums. Cursing, Tony grits his teeth as Peter’s hips push down against his erection, stars blooming behind his lids at the near painful pleasure he gets from his jeans rubbing into his cock.

Peter pants against his neck and Tony can feel the tears the boy has shed, apparently overcome with pleasure. A sick wave of pride swells within him that he’s made Peter feel so good he’s left in tears, and that same thing makes him wonder what it would be like to do it again, except this time, with Peter spread out beneath him so he can watch him plead and cry.

Eventually Peter’s breathing evens out and Tony can feel him go lax in his arms, sleepy little noises making him smile. He adjusts his grip and stands, holding Peter as he ascends the stairs slowly, steps steady and quiet. He pauses for a moment, considering what the most responsible option is here, and after a moment of hesitation, heads to the end of the hallway to his bedroom.

When he tries to put Peter down and pull away, the young man makes a sleepy noise of protest and wraps his hand in Tony’s T-shirt, holding onto him tightly. “Stay,” he slurs, eyes opening in a soft flutter, “please.”

Tony wavers for a minute and then nods, “Okay kid, lemme just get you under the covers,” he murmurs, gently guiding Peter’s lax limbs beneath his sheets. Peter curls up and smiles sleepily at him and the sight leaves Tony momentarily breathless.

He stares at him, motionless for a moment before shaking his head and stripping quickly. He tosses his T-shirt aside and pulls on soft cotton pants, stilling when he glances up and finds Peter watching him through hooded eyes. He’s seen that look on the faces of other pretty young things before he takes them to bed, but to see it now on the face of someone he considers family, whose never looked at him like that before, it makes his gut twist.

He debates not getting into bed, thinks that he should take the safer route(hah—nothing is safe anymore now that he knows what Peter sounds like when he cums) and go back down to his office but Peter pouts at him and holds out a hand and he’s weak, so, so weak, so he slides beneath the covers and moments later Peter is snuggling into him with a soft contented sound.

Pressing his lips to Peter’s hair, he rubs a hand over his spine slowly, “Sleep sweetheart,” he encourages, eyes falling shut as Peter wriggles and then sighs, tucking his face into Tony’s throat.

“Night Tony,” he whispers, breath warm on his skin.

Tony shivers, hands tightening on him, “Night kid.”

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

It turns into a routine; Peter stays the night, can’t sleep, and winds up in his bed before the night is through. There’s no repeat of that first time in his office—he’s painfully careful when touching Peter now, but he sees it in his eyes, a yearning for more, and he can’t deny that despite his best efforts, the memory is now at the forefront of his thoughts when he jacks off.

He knows it isn’t normal, isn’t safe, but he can’t quite bring himself to stop. He can’t resist when Peter comes to him with pleading eyes and dark circles beneath his eyes.

Eventually though it’s not just about insomnia, because Peter comes to his room after Harley falls asleep and slides into his bed, and if he’s honest with himself it’s the best sleep he’s gotten in years. He shouldn’t let it continue, he knows that, and yet he can’t quite bring himself to stop it.

~~~~~~~~~~~

Predictably, Peter is ecstatic upon receiving his car, launching himself into Tony’s arms with a grin of delight, babbling thanks as Tony laughs and hugs him back, fingers curling in soft curls to hold him closer, tighter. May’s eyes sparkle and Harley grins, and it all feels…right.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

He’s in the middle of explaining something, head under the hood of the car while he waits for Peter to find the wrench he needs, when suddenly there’s a warm presence at his back. He realizes with a stutter that Peter’s pressed against him, peering over his shoulder at the engine, one hand bracing in between his shoulders as the other sets down the wrench on the engine block.

Thing is, Peter doesn’t move.

“So what’s the issue?” Peter asks in his ear and he realizes he’s stopped talking, heat crawling up his face when Peter leans over further, hips pressing into Tony’s as his fingers dig into his back. He represses a shudder at the touch and nods, goes back to explaining what they’re fixing and why.

Tries to put it out of his mind.

Except, it happens again.

The next time they’re working on the car it seems like Peter brushes into or against him any chance he can, hands lingering unnecessarily while he gazes at Tony through hooded eyes.

He ignores it, or does his best to anyway, but it’s hard to ignore when the kid is in his bed every night he stays over. He’d say something to May about changing her shifts, but he knows they pay more for third shift, and there’s a very large part of him that doesn’t want it to stop because then he wouldn’t be able to sleep so he says nothing.

It’s just Peter he tries to reason, the kid he’s known since his voice was cracking, the kid who is, essentially, family. It’s just an infatuation, he assures himself, nothing to worry about.

Except he can’t get it out of his head, the sounds he made, the way he gasped Tony’s name, the shudder he’d felt beneath his palms as he came.

It’s a goddamn nightmare is what it is.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Everything comes to a head one evening while he and Peter work on the Bug—May at work and Harley on a date. Tony has worked hard to avoid being alone like this with Peter—but still hasn’t managed to keep him from his bed.

He offhandedly orders Peter to stop fucking around with the box cutter, head beneath the hood of the car while he twists at the bolt he’s been trying to loosen for five minutes when he hears Peter curse. When he comes up, he finds Peter shirtless, fabric wrapped around his palm where he’s apparently cut himself.

Panic sluices through Tony and he slams the hood of the car shut, grabs Peter and makes him sit, ignoring his protests of I’m fine Tony, honestly, in favor of grabbing his first aid kit and stool. Tossing the kit on the hood, he slides his glasses up his nose and unwraps the shirt, grimacing in sympathy.

It’s a deep cut, but not too long, half an inch and easily taken care of. He cleans it, eyes shooting up to Peter’s face when he hisses, shaking his head when he looks back down at the wound.

“I told you to be careful,” he mutters.

“I was!”

“Mmhm, that’s why I’m bandaging up your hand, hmm?”

“It’s fine, honestly, doesn’t even hurt that bad!”

“It’s not fine,” Tony replies through clenched teeth, his carefully held control wavering at the sight of Peter’s blood on his hands. “I tell you to do something while we’re working, you do it. There are dangerous tools in here and if I tell you to stop touching something, you need to listen.”

“Yea well, you’re not my dad.”

Tony peers through the curtains above the kitchen sink, smirking as Harley and Peter cannonball into the pool, laughing and splashing happily. They’ve been inseparable since Peter and his aunt had moved in next door three years ago. Peter was just on the edge of 14, weeks from his birthday and upon meeting Harley had found a friend for life.

It’s three weeks to Peter’s 17th birthday and Tony and May have been planning his party for months. The vintage VW Bug he’s purchased for Peter would be an extravagant gift if it wasn’t a rusted out junker that would need a full year of work to get it operational.

He had told May of his plans to have he and Peter work on the vehicle together so the kid would learn practical skills in mechanical engineering, a topic he knew fascinated Peter. He’d assured her he’d cover the cost of parts, and so long as Peter kept his grades up, he’d get the keys to the vehicle the day he turned 18.

He’d done the same thing for Harley and the two years of hard work had paid off—the shiny cherry red 76 Camaro was parked in the driveway and had earned Harley a full ride to the local technical college and the offer of a job from a local garage.

He hopes that Peter will have as much fun working on the car with him; the kid is naturally curious and staggeringly smart, so Tony’s sure he’ll pick up quickly on the skills needed to repair the vehicle that’s now waiting in the garage, covered by a tarp, just waiting to be revealed on his birthday.

The screeching of the screen door draws his attention to where Peter is careening around the corner, eyes going wide as his wet feet slip on the tile. He watches in slow motion as Peter falls forward, right for the sharp corner of the granite countertop.

He’s moving before he realizes it, grabbing Peter’s arms and hauling him up, mere breaths before he slams into the unforgiving stone. His heart beats too fast as he holds onto the kid for just a beat longer than normal, one hand plastered to the wet skin of his back.

“Shit,” he breathes, pulling back to run an assessing gaze over Peter, free hand tangling in those soft brown curls. “You gotta slow down kid, I don’t want to have to take you to the hospital again. Your Aunt almost murdered me last time.”

Peter flushes and nods, glancing away as he bites his lip, “Sorry Tony,” he murmurs, looking up through his lashes at Tony. He worries at his lower lip with his teeth and Tony watches as it turns a rosy shade of pink at the attention, wet and shiny and something curls warm and wanting through his gut.

Clearing his throat he steps back and pats the kid’s shoulder awkwardly, “Great, uh, dinner in thirty,” he mutters before turning away and attempting to focus his attention on the chicken kebabs he had been working on.

He listens to Peter rustling through the fridge for a snack before he disappears back out to the pool, laughing loudly at something Harley says too softly for him to hear. Glancing out the window, he watches as Peter throws his head back, eyes shut as he laughs, stepping back and then swaying as he loses his balance on the edge of the pool and promptly falls in with a shriek.

Tony can’t help the laugh that bursts out, affection warm in his chest. He continues skewering chicken and vegetables, the earlier moment with Peter pushed far from his mind.

The further from his mind, the better.

trail.content_abstract:
Tony peers through the curtains above the kitchen sink, smirking as Harley and Peter cannonball into the pool, laughing and splashing happily. They’ve been inseparable since Peter and his aunt had moved in next door three years ago. Peter was just on the edge of 14, weeks from his birthday and upon meeting Harley had found a friend for life.

It’s three weeks to Peter’s 17th birthday and Tony and May have been planning his party for months. The vintage VW Bug he’s purchased for Peter would be an extravagant gift if it wasn’t a rusted out junker that would need a full year of work to get it operational.

He had told May of his plans to have he and Peter work on the vehicle together so the kid would learn practical skills in mechanical engineering, a topic he knew fascinated Peter. He’d assured her he’d cover the cost of parts, and so long as Peter kept his grades up, he’d get the keys to the vehicle the day he turned 18.

He’d done the same thing for Harley and the two years of hard work had paid off—the shiny cherry red 76 Camaro was parked in the driveway and had earned Harley a full ride to the local technical college and the offer of a job from a local garage.

He hopes that Peter will have as much fun working on the car with him; the kid is naturally curious and staggeringly smart, so Tony’s sure he’ll pick up quickly on the skills needed to repair the vehicle that’s now waiting in the garage, covered by a tarp, just waiting to be revealed on his birthday.

The screeching of the screen door draws his attention to where Peter is careening around the corner, eyes going wide as his wet feet slip on the tile. He watches in slow motion as Peter falls forward, right for the sharp corner of the granite countertop.

He’s moving before he realizes it, grabbing Peter’s arms and hauling him up, mere breaths before he slams into the unforgiving stone. His heart beats too fast as he holds onto the kid for just a beat longer than normal, one hand plastered to the wet skin of his back.

“Shit,” he breathes, pulling back to run an assessing gaze over Peter, free hand tangling in those soft brown curls. “You gotta slow down kid, I don’t want to have to take you to the hospital again. Your Aunt almost murdered me last time.”

Peter flushes and nods, glancing away as he bites his lip, “Sorry Tony,” he murmurs, looking up through his lashes at Tony. He worries at his lower lip with his teeth and Tony watches as it turns a rosy shade of pink at the attention, wet and shiny and something curls warm and wanting through his gut.

Clearing his throat he steps back and pats the kid’s shoulder awkwardly, “Great, uh, dinner in thirty,” he mutters before turning away and attempting to focus his attention on the chicken kebabs he had been working on.

He listens to Peter rustling through the fridge for a snack before he disappears back out to the pool, laughing loudly at something Harley says too softly for him to hear. Glancing out the window, he watches as Peter throws his head back, eyes shut as he laughs, stepping back and then swaying as he loses his balance on the edge of the pool and promptly falls in with a shriek.

Tony can’t help the laugh that bursts out, affection warm in his chest. He continues skewering chicken and vegetables, the earlier moment with Peter pushed far from his mind.

The further from his mind, the better.
